structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.text: The clerks of the supreme judicial and superior courts shall, before each sitting and at such other times as the respective courts may order, issue writs of venire facias for jurors, requiring their attendance on such day of the sitting as the court may order. The number of jurors required by such writs shall be apportioned among the cities and towns, as nearly as may be, according to their respective populations.
